intro: Morelosia virgata, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and delicate, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Morelosia virgata is often used in ornamental gardening for its graceful appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established.
